00031 class KHLAEvent : public KEvent {

00047         Bool_t IsSame(const KHLAEvent &anEvent, Bool_t bPrint = false) const;
00048         Bool_t operator==(const KHLAEvent &anEvent) const { return IsSame(anEvent,false); }
00049         Bool_t operator!=(const KHLAEvent &anEvent) const { return !(*this==anEvent); }
00050         virtual void Compact(void);
00051         
00052         //Easy Access Methods
00053         //These methods access commonly requested quantities without
00054         //having to dig down into the branch structure.

00114         //TBits fDataCleaningWord;  //each bit in this word represents the pass/fail of this event to specific data cleaning cuts
00115 
00116         KHLABoloSysRecord fBoloSystem;  
00117         KHLAMuonVetoSysRecord fMuonSystem; 
00118         
00119         //Array of SubRecords containing event information
00120         Int_t fNumSamba; //the number of Samba Sub Records in this event
00121         Int_t fNumBolo; //the number of Single Bolo Sub Records in this event
00122         Int_t fNumBoloPulse; //the number of Bolo Pulse Sub Records in this event
00123         Int_t fNumMuonModule; //the number of Muon Module Sub Records in this event. 
00124         
00125         //do we need to store these values in the tree? how much disk space would
00126         //we save? There are two ways
00127         //a user can determine the number of these records in the event.
00128         //1) - from a root script that calls Event::GetNumSamba, etc...
00129         //2) - from the TTree selections of
00130         //         @fSamba.size()>0
00131         //         @fBolo.size()>0
00132         //         @fBoloPulse.size()>0
00133         //         @fMuModlue.size()>0
00134         // For example root [0] TFile f("EDSRunFile.root");
00135         //             root [1] t->Scan("*","@fBolo.size()==1");
00136         // selects all of the events where there is only one bolometer
00137         // with a record in the event. Now.. this doesn't (YET?) guarantee
00138         // that only one Bolometer in the event has a real physics event
00139         // it only tells you the number of records in the data structure
00140         
00141         TClonesArray *fSamba; //->  pointer to the array of Samba Sub Records
00142         TClonesArray *fBolo; //->  pointer to the array of Single Bolo Sub Records
00143         TClonesArray *fBoloPulse;  //-> pointer to the array of Bolo Pulse Sub Records
00144         TClonesArray *fMuonModule; //-> pointer to the array of Muon Module Sub Records
00145         
00146         /*NOTE - I am using short names here in order to improve the readability
00147          of the TTree when looking at the file from the TBrowser or from
00148          the TTree::Show TTree::Scan methods. 
00149          
00150          ALSO, the names of the system record class and the TClonesArrays
00151          should be EXACTLY the same as the names used in ALL Other Event Levels, 
00152          such as the Raw level and the MC level. This makes it easy for porting
00153          analysis code for each level... 
00154          
00155          In principle, everybody doing analysis should use each Class's Member 
00156          Functions, rather than directly reading from the TTree. This ensures 
00157          that the data in the TTrees are properly encapsulated and the user 
00158          doesn't NEED to know the structure or the names of the underlying 
00159          TTree.... This is especially important if the underlying data 
00160          structure changes! By using member functions in a ROOT script or 
00161          compiled code, you're no longer dependent upon the exact naming 
00162          structure in your analysis. 
00163          But, since many people are still uncomfortable with C++
00164          and many people are still doing their 
00165          analysis by direct interaction with the data Tree, we will support 
00166          them as much as possible by using these easy-to-read names that 
00167          are the same accross the different "levels".
00168          
00169          */
00170         
00171         //private methods
00172         template<class T> T* AddSubRecord(TClonesArray *mArray, Int_t &mCount);
00173         void ClearArray(Option_t *anOpt, TClonesArray *mArray, Int_t &mCount);
00174         void CreateArrays(void);
00175         void InitializeMembers(void);
00176         void CopyLocalMembers(const KHLAEvent &anEvent);
00177         void CopyClonesArrays(const KHLAEvent &anEvent);
00178         void CopyFromRawEvent(const KRawEvent &anEvent);
00179         
00180         ClassDef(KHLAEvent ,1);
00181 };
